channel.title: I need a keycode
channel.description:
I need the keycode for the button on the bottom row of the keyboard to the right of the shift bar between the start and the ctrl key for a program that I'm working on
Sorry I don't know the name of it but it brings up the mouse right click menu
Thanks

item.title: I need a keycode
item.dc:creator: @person1936temp person1936temp
item.description:
@person1936temp wrote:

juslilolme1:

:rolleyes: ;D I’m still curious does anyone know the name of that key? the mouse menu key?

i think its called the menu key lol pretty lame name… well thats microsoft for you

Read full topic

item.title: I need a keycode
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“juslilolme1, post:3, topic:235433”]Thanks magma I should have expected that.

I really wish that I knew how to read information from the keyboard with scar. Google returns functions that require libraries not included with and I have not seen the function that can read key codes or just don’t know how to use it.

if you tell me the key function. I will find the way to use it.

Thanks again

runescape3dude its on the other side of the keyboard to the RIGHT between the start(windows key) and the control key … the side near the arrows :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 07, 2008, 06:24:34 pm[/size][hr]thanks for your help. I just found a better way to do it.
In firefox alt + enter is a keyboard option to save link as instead of right click keydown(getkeycode(k)); wait(20); keyup(getkeycode(k));

gotta love firefox [/quote]
The keyboard I was on at the time had no key there.

Read full topic

item.title: I need a keycode
item.dc:creator: @juslilolme1 juslilolme1
item.description:
@juslilolme1 wrote:

that’s it its some times called the application key or the select key

key code - 93

I found a keycode instant checker at webonweboffhttp://webonweboff.com/tips/js/event_key_codes.aspx

Read full topic

item.title: I need a keycode
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:2, topic:235433”][quote author=juslilolme1 link=topic=310487.msg2477980#msg2477980 date=1223369739]
I need the keycode for the button on the bottom row of the keyboard to the right of the shift bar between the start and the ctrl key for a program that I’m working on

Sorry I don’t know the name of it but it brings up the mouse right click menu

Thanks
[/quote]
There isn’t a button between CTRL and Start(Win Key)… Unless you mean Alt which is next to it, between the Win Key and the space bar…[/quote]
lolretard
[center] This isnt the kind of behavior we except from the members of our community.[/center]

Read full topic

item.title: I need a keycode
item.dc:creator: @juslilolme1 juslilolme1
item.description:
@juslilolme1 wrote:

Thanks magma I should have expected that.

I really wish that I knew how to read information from the keyboard with scar. Google returns functions that require libraries not included with and I have not seen the function that can read key codes or just don’t know how to use it.

if you tell me the key function. I will find the way to use it.

Thanks again

runescape3dude its on the other side of the keyboard to the RIGHT between the start(windows key) and the control key … the side near the arrows :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 07, 2008, 06:24:34 pm[/size][hr]thanks for your help. I just found a better way to do it.
In firefox alt + enter is a keyboard option to save link as instead of right click keydown(getkeycode(k)); wait(20); keyup(getkeycode(k));

gotta love firefox

Read full topic
